JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the Court by Mr H. Yılmaz , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , at TIME , the applicant 's husband , PERSON and his friend , PERSON , were shot by unknown perpetrator(s ) in the centre of PERSON , a district attached to ORG . The security forces , arriving shortly after the incident , transferred the applicant 's husband and PERSON to a state hospital , where they died .

On DATE the security forces drafted an incident report and drew up a sketch map . CARDINAL spent CARDINAL-mm cartridges were found at the scene and sent for ballistics examination . According to the incident report , when the police officers arrived at the scene of the incident , Mr PERSON and PERSON PERSON were lying on their backs in a pool of blood , surrounded by a crowd of QUANTITY people . They were immediately transferred to the hospital . Afterwards the police officers collected evidence and tried to collect eyewitness statements . However , no one was able to testify as to what had happened , since they all claimed only to have heard gunshots . The report also mentions that Mr PERSON and PERSON were known to be ORG ( ORG of Kurdistan ) sympathisers .

On DATE , a post - mortem examination of PERSON body was carried out by CARDINAL pathologists in the presence of the PERSON public prosecutor and Mr PERSON , the deceased 's brother . According to the verbatim record , the deceased was DATE , QUANTITY tall and weighed QUANTITY . He had black hair , brown eyes and a brown moustache . The record further described the deceased 's clothing and personal items found on his person . Rigor mortis and post - mortem hypostasis had not yet set in . An external examination revealed the following injuries : a bullet entry wound QUANTITY in front of the right ear lobe and a bullet exit wound on the left side of the head which had destroyed the left ear lobe . A bullet entry wound QUANTITY below the right ear lobe and a bullet exit wound on the left occipital bone , which had broken the bone . CARDINAL further bullet entry wounds on the right side of the head were identified together with a single bullet exit wound from the left side of the head . A bullet entry wound on the right elbow and a bullet entry wound on the right arm were observed . The experts also noted a bullet entry wound on the front of the left shoulder , an exit wound on the left front shoulder QUANTITY from the previous entry wound , and another bullet entry wound on the chest , on the left next to the sternum .

The doctors concluded that the cause of death was haemorrhage and damage to the cerebral tissue as a result of wounds caused by firearms . They considered that there was no need to carry out a classical autopsy as the cause of death was clear from the findings of the external examination . The prosecutor agreed . Afterwards the body of the deceased was given to the family for burial and a bullet extracted from the body of the deceased retained as evidence .

On DATE , the preliminary investigation into the killings was instigated by the PERSON public prosecutor . He requested ORG to secure the presence of family members of the deceased in order to take statements from them .

On an unspecified date the applicant moved to GPE with her children because other family members had received death threats . Fearing for her safety the applicant neither pursued the investigation into the death of her husband nor lodged a civil or administrative action with the authorities , as she did not want her address to be known .

On DATE the ORG submitted an additional incident report to the PERSON prosecutor 's office , which contained the same information as that of the first incident report . This report stated that it had been established that the deceased were active ORG sympathisers .

On DATE , the police took witness statements from CARDINAL people who either lived or worked in the street where the killing took place . PERSON claimed that she was not at home at the time of the incident . Mr GPE submitted that his shop was closed on DATE of the incident . PERSON ORG and PERSON claimed to have heard gunshots but that they were not witnesses to the incident .

In the meantime ORG conducted a ballistics examination of the CARDINAL spent cartridges found at the scene . The report issued on DATE stated that the cartridges examined were CARDINAL PERSON cartridges of CARDINAL different groups of foreign origin and that they were fired from CARDINAL different guns .

On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor heard the applicant 's brother - in - law and PERSON father . They both submitted that they did not know who could have committed the killing and requested that those responsible be brought to justice .

On DATE the ORG informed the PERSON public prosecutor that the investigation into the killings was ongoing and that the perpetrators had not yet been identified . The Government submitted numerous items of similar correspondence of various dates between the prosecutor and ORG .

On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor relinquished jurisdiction over the case since he considered that the killing of the deceased , who were known to be active ORG sympathisers , by unknown perpetrators , fell within the jurisdiction of the public prosecutor at ORG .

On DATE the ORG informed the PERSON public prosecutor that CARDINAL suspects arrested following an operation conducted against ORG had claimed that Mr K.A. was responsible for the killing of the applicant 's husband and PERSON and that the security forces were working to capture the suspect .

On DATE the prosecutor at ORG ordered the PERSON and ORG and ORG to coordinate their efforts in the search for the perpetrators . The prosecutor instructed that he be informed of any tipoffs , confessions or any other evidence regarding the incident as well as briefed on developments in the case DATE . The prosecutor also requested the collaboration of the PERSON public prosecutor in this respect .
On DATE the ORG informed the prosecutor that they were still searching for Mr K.A.

In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant requested the public prosecutor 's office at ORG to provide her with a copy of her husband 's death certificate to be submitted to ORG authorities for the establishment of a pension . She personally received the relevant document on DATE .

On DATE the applicant lodged a petition with the PERSON public prosecutor 's office and requested information as regards the developments in the investigation into the death of her husband . In this petition , the applicant also stated that in her view her husband had been killed either by the security forces or by militia acting in collusion with them
On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor informed the applicant that the case regarding the death of her husband had been transferred to the public prosecutor 's office at ORG on DATE .

On an unspecified date the applicant lodged a request with the PERSON public prosecutor 's office for information as regards the developments in the investigation into the death of her husband . The applicant noted that the documents sent to her by the prosecutor 's office concerned only the investigation conducted immediately after the death of her husband . She requested to know what additional steps had been undertaken by the prosecutor and whether any new evidence had been admitted to the case file . She repeated that in her view her husband had been killed either by the security forces or by militia acting in collusion with them .

On DATE Mr GPE , a public prosecutor at ORG , with reference to the applicant 's request dated DATE , informed the applicant that the investigation into the killing of her husband and PERSON was ongoing and that the perpetrator(s ) had not yet been found .

On DATE ORG informed the prosecutor that it had not been possible to identify the gun with which the CARDINAL PERSON cartridges of foreign origin had been fired , as no information had been found linking them to any gun stored in the database .

The Government submitted numerous items of correspondence of various dates in which various ORG regularly informed the prosecutor in charge of the case file about developments in the search for the alleged perpetrator of the killings .

On DATE public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment against Mr GPE accusing him of membership of an illegal armed organisation , namely ORG , and of participating in armed activities on its behalf .

On DATE Mr K.A. , who was carrying a false identity card , was arrested . On DATE he was questioned by the police . On that date , Mr K.A. submitted that in the nineties PERSON was mixed ideologically , that he had joined a religious community in DATE and that until DATE there was no concept of ORG . PERSON maintained that until DATE when a fellow community member Mr PERSON was killed by the ORG their only activities were to gather and to discuss ORG . After this killing it became dangerous to move from one street to another and as a result street patrols were created . PERSON claimed that DATE after that incident he became part of the military wing of the community , since it had become clear to the community that if they did not fight back they would be killed by the ORG . He gave details about the subsequent structure of the organisation of the community and the killings perpetrated by him and other members on various dates . Mr PERSON was later asked to comment on a number of documents found following an operation conducted in the house of the leader of the organisation on DATE and police statements of fellow members . Mr K.A. , when asked about his involvement in the killing of the applicant 's husband , denied taking part in it . He further maintained that after DATE his ties with the organisation had lessened .

On the same date PERSON was heard by a public prosecutor and a judge at a ORG , where he denied being part of the armed wing of ORG and participating in any killings . PERSON was subsequently remanded in custody .

On DATE and DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed additional bills of indictment against PERSON and other suspects for , inter alia , participating in armed activities on behalf of ORG . In respect of Mr K.A. these were the killing of PERSON on DATE , PERSON on DATE , Mr GPE on DATE and PERSON on DATE . He was also accused of participating in the attempted killing of PERSON and PERSON on DATE . All these incidents took place in PERSON .
On DATE the ORG informed the PERSON public prosecutor that Mr PERSON had been arrested in DATE following an operation conducted against ORG and was currently in detention .

On DATE the prosecutor at ORG filed an additional bill of indictment against Mr K.A. for inter alia , participating in armed activities on behalf of ORG . This time Mr K.A. was accused of killing the applicant 's husband and PERSON .

On DATE the criminal proceedings against Mr K.A. regarding the killing of the applicant 's husband and of PERSON commenced before ORG ( no . CARDINAL ) . The applicant and PERSON wife were written down as plaintiffs ( müşteki ) and the court ordered that their statements be heard .

In the next hearing held on DATE Mr K.A. was heard by ORG . He denied all the charges against him . In particular , he submitted that he did not kill the applicant 's husband and PERSON . He also stated that Mr PERSON and PERSON GPE had been tried and acquitted as regards the same incident . The court decided to join the case related to the applicant 's husband 's killing to another case pending before it ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

Throughout the criminal proceedings a number of related cases pending before various courts and concerning PERSON and other suspects and their activities on behalf of ORG were joined to case no . CARDINAL .
On DATE PERSON , wife of Mr PERSON , was heard by the court , which was acting on rogatory letters , and she maintained that she had not witnessed the events and had no knowledge of the incident .

In the course of the trial , the first - instance court heard witnesses and the accused and collected documents from various authorities . It also appears that the court tried unsuccessfully several times to locate the applicant in order to obtain her testimony via rogatory letters . Throughout this time Mr K.A. denied all accusations , submitted that he had been ill - treated during police custody and claimed his innocence .

On DATE ORG , in a CARDINAL-page reasoned judgment , delivered its verdict in the trial in respect of CARDINAL of the accused . Having regard to the evidence in the case file , the court found it established that Mr K.A. was member of an illegal armed organisation , namely ORG , and that he had participated in a number of armed activities on its behalf , including the killing of the applicant 's husband on DATE , and sentenced him to life imprisonment . It transpires from the reasoned judgment of ORG that proceedings before its Sixth ORG concerning another suspect , who had originally been arrested in the operation conducted inCARDINAL and was currently being tried in absentia for taking part in the applicant 's husband 's killing , were pending .
The case against Mr K.A. is pending before ORG .
A description of the relevant domestic law at the material time can be found in GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINALII ( extracts ) .
